history.text: what do you think about the movie
I think it sounds like a great movie.  Dragons have always been an interest of mine and it's presented in 3-D which I think it cool technology
It looks like it had great special effects
Judging by the ratings it would appear that many other people enjoyed it too although there may have been room for improvement.  A 74/100 to me would be a C in general education grades
I also enjoy witty movies, it goes with the sense of humor I exhibit normally
it seems to be an insightful story to the movie with a lot of animation
It is a comedy movie which I usually like
Do you tend to favor a certain production company? Such as dreamworks/Pixar?
Yes I think dreamworks and Pixar make quality movies
I usually favor PIXAR because I think they tend to make movies that are more riveting and attention capturing but this sounds like a good DreamWorks contribution
Didnt America Ferrera used to be in a tv series. shes a voice on the movie
This movie has funny character names: Hiccup Horrendous Haddock III and Toothless
This adds to the comedy element of the movie
yes America Ferrera stars in superstore and ugly betty.  I enjoy the show superstore and think she's pretty funny.  She also has a unique voice that I could see lending to an animated character
I remeber Ugly betty but I did not know she was in superstore

An interesting thing to note is in the key scene it mentions shooting down a night fury, which is a rare and dangerous dragon; however, Hiccup's companion toothless is a night fury...doesn't sound like toothless is dangerous though with a name like that.
Oh based off key scene 2 it seems like toothless was the dragon shot down?
Hiccup is a funny name so is toothless so this adds to the comedy element of the film
He ends up setting the dragon free which i imagine leads to a happy ending
I like that Stoick is voiced by Gerard Butler.  He's such a versatile actor
I never heard of him before what are some of his other films
He voices Hiccups father

He's played in 300, gamer, a few romantic comedies as well.  He usually plays in action movies and movies meant for adults so I find it somewhat interesting he would be in this animated movie for what I would assume would be children
Maybe he wanted to try something different
Based on the synopsis does this seem like a movie you would be interested in seeing?
Looks like you were right, they all live in harmony at the end
No i dont really like antimated movies that much but I think it would be good for children
Do you generally watch movies based on ratings? Do you care about ratings for movies?
No i just pick movies that i think will be interesting
I do as well, I still get netflix movies
